#summary The draggable attribute specifies whether the element can be the source of a drag-and-drop operation.
#labels about-html,is-html-attribute,from-whatwg

You are here: [Welcome Home] > [HTMLReference HTML Reference] > [HTMLElements Elements] > [DivElement <div> element] > *draggable attribute*

== Usage ==

[SpecificationHTML5 HTML 5] says, "The `draggable` attribute controls whether or not the element is draggable. Generally, only text selections are draggable, but elements whose `draggable` DOM attribute is `true` become draggable as well."

== Values ==

  * `true`
  * `false`
  * (missing value): if the element is an [ImgElement img element] or a [AElement hyperlink], `draggable` defaults to `true`, otherwise `false`.

== Elements ==

You can use the `draggable` attribute on any element.
